intro: Rutidea smithii subsp. smithii, commonly known as the Smith's rutidea, is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, typically found in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a deep root system to access moisture from deeper soil layers.
